text: <@U11CP8FF1|ibmamnt> has joined the channel
I wonder if fabric-cop eventually provides Docker image just like membersrvc, is there any plan ?

Also, I wonder what is the procedure to use previous membersrvc with modification (such as membersrvc.yaml to change enrollSecret for admin/webappadmin) to that it can not be intruded by known password ?
<@U11CP8FF1> - yes - there are a few change requests in the pipeline for a Docker image for fabric-cop

<@U11CP8FF1> - not sure I understand the question about membersrvcs?   You can always set your own enrollID / enrollSecret for a "bootstrap / admin" user for your instance of membership services.   You can simply change the enrollID and enrollSecret to anything you want - just make sure you a user with the role to create new users
Hello, can anybody tell me how to get access to <https://docs.google.com/document/d/1TO-sdHGpn8ifB9C_pH_y54H75Rx0RdXvZih7-lhsLII/edit> (design document of client for COP)
<@U307KJEDU|webkruncher> has joined the channel
<@U327VGGF9>: yes, a lot is getting changed (from interfaces all the way to core functionality). At least on the “Membership Services” side, the “logic” is similar (ECerts, TCerts, ….).

It really depends on what you are (currently) doing with fabric. If you have a lot of things to develop and test on the application side, maybe it’s better to start/continue with 0.6 for now, as it changes less.
After holidays I expect more work and focus around clean-up tasks, etc… which will make it easier for you to start working in earnest with `v1.0` / `master` branch.

It’s a general advice, of course. (Obviously I don’t have all the details/picture regarding what exactly you are doing). I’m happy with v0.6 for the stuff I’m doing, for example… and I do expect to upgrade next year (no in the coming few weeks, in my case).
<@U1GPHH6PQ> what is this file/link please? FWIW, I don’t have access to it either.
Where did you find it? Is it in a JIRA or so?
the link is referenced by the SDK design document here: <https://docs.google.com/document/d/1R5RtIBMW9fZpli37E5Li5_Q9ve3BnQ4q3gWmGZj6Sv4/edit#>
<@U32ND8W73|emtrevin> has joined the channel
<@U1GPHH6PQ>, oh I see. Let’s ask Jim [@jzhang] then.
<@U13TWBRBL> is the google doc referenced above supposed to be publicly available (say, for reading) ? Please see <@U1GPHH6PQ> ’s question above.
<@U13TWBRBL|jzhang> has joined the channel
<@U1GPHH6PQ> <@U11MANG9G> I thought I had opened it up for public viewing, checking the doc’s permission again...
should be public now
Honestly, today was the first time I clicked this link :wink:. Otherwise, I would have reported this too.
Works like a charm (for me). Thank you Jim. <@U1GPHH6PQ>: can you (re) try?
note that it’s just a placeholder for the latest membership services design, that is consumable to the application developers or implementors of the SDK spec.
right now it’s got outdated content
